Green Teas.description: Explore different types of tea, their production processes and health advantages, while keeping track of your personal tea journey.

details.description: An Ju Bai Cha is a delicate Chinese green tea with light, silvery-green leaves that offer a sweet and refreshing flavor.
details.origin: This tea comes from Anji County, China, and is prized for its delicate processing and gentle flavor profile.
details.harvest_notes: Harvested in early spring, the young leaves retain their freshness and vibrant taste.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of An Ju Bai Cha in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 3-5 minutes to enjoy its subtle flavors.
details.health_benefits: Rich in antioxidants, this tea promotes hydration and supports digestion.
details.popularity: Highly regarded among tea connoisseurs, it is cherished for its refined and gentle taste.

details.description: Bancha is made from the older, mature leaves of the tea plant harvested later in the season, offering a robust flavor and a comforting aroma.
details.origin: This tea is from Japan, where it is commonly enjoyed as an everyday beverage.
details.harvest_notes: Picked after the first flush of the season, Bancha’s leaves are larger and more mature, contributing to its fuller flavor.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Bancha in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a refreshing cup.
details.health_benefits: Bancha is known for its potential to help with digestion and support heart health.
details.popularity: A favorite in Japanese households, it provides a soothing, everyday tea experience.

details.description: Bi Luo Chun, also known as 'Green Snail Spring,' is a fragrant Chinese green tea with a delicate, floral flavor and tight, curled leaves.
details.origin: This tea is grown in the Jiangsu Province of China, where its unique appearance and fragrance are highly regarded.
details.harvest_notes: Hand-picked in early spring, the leaves are carefully rolled into tight spirals to preserve their fresh, floral character.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Bi Luo Chun in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes to reveal its aromatic notes.
details.health_benefits: Bi Luo Chun is rich in antioxidants, which can help reduce stress and support cognitive function.
details.popularity: A beloved tea in China, it’s known for its sweet, delicate flavor and enchanting aroma.

details.description: Dragon Well, or Longjing, is a famous Chinese green tea known for its flat leaves and nutty, slightly sweet flavor.
details.origin: This tea is grown in Hangzhou, China, and is one of the most celebrated green teas worldwide.
details.harvest_notes: Picked in early spring, the tender leaves are pan-roasted to preserve their fresh, vegetal taste.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Dragon Well in water heated to 85°C (185°F) for 2-3 minutes for a rich, flavorful cup.
details.health_benefits: This tea may support metabolism, improve digestion, and promote healthy skin.
details.popularity: Longjing is a well-known tea that is revered for its smooth and nutty flavor, enjoyed by tea lovers worldwide.

details.description: En Shi Yu Lu is a high-quality Chinese green tea from the Hubei Province, known for its rich flavor and fragrant aroma.
details.origin: This tea is from Enshi, Hubei, where unique growing techniques are used to produce its refreshing and smooth taste.
details.harvest_notes: Harvested in early spring, the leaves are processed with a special method that retains their freshness and vibrant green color.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of En Shi Yu Lu in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for the best flavor.
details.health_benefits: This tea supports immune health and provides a gentle energy boost.
details.popularity: Known for its quality and flavor, En Shi Yu Lu is appreciated by those who enjoy a refreshing and aromatic green tea.

details.description: Fenggang Zinc Selenium Tea is a mineral-rich green tea that provides a unique, earthy flavor and offers health-boosting properties.
details.origin: Grown in the Fenggang region of China, this tea is rich in zinc and selenium, which contribute to its distinctive flavor.
details.harvest_notes: Picked during the spring season, the leaves are carefully processed to retain their beneficial minerals and antioxidants.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Fenggang Zinc Selenium Tea in water heated to 85°C (185°F) for 2-3 minutes to bring out its full mineral richness.
details.health_benefits: Rich in zinc and selenium, this tea may support immune health and reduce inflammation.
details.popularity: Popular for its health benefits, this tea is a favorite among those seeking a mineral-rich brew.

details.description: Genmaicha is a Japanese green tea blend mixed with roasted brown rice, giving it a nutty, comforting flavor.
details.origin: A traditional tea from Japan, Genmaicha is commonly enjoyed as a casual, everyday tea.
details.harvest_notes: The rice is roasted alongside the green tea leaves, imparting a toasted aroma and flavor.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Genmaicha in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 3-5 minutes to enjoy its nutty flavor.
details.health_benefits: Genmaicha may promote digestion and help reduce stress, making it an ideal comfort tea.
details.popularity: Widely consumed in Japan, this tea is often referred to as 'popcorn tea' due to the roasted rice.

details.description: Gyokuro is a premium shade-grown Japanese green tea with a rich, sweet flavor and smooth texture.
details.origin: This tea is grown in Japan’s Uji region, where it’s shaded from sunlight to enhance its natural sweetness.
details.harvest_notes: Harvested in early spring, Gyokuro’s leaves are shaded for up to three weeks to produce a rich, umami flavor.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Gyokuro in water heated to 60°C (140°F) for 2-3 minutes for a sweet, smooth infusion.
details.health_benefits: Gyokuro may promote relaxation, focus, and overall well-being.
details.popularity: Known for its premium quality, Gyokuro is a favorite among tea connoisseurs who appreciate its complexity and rich taste.

details.description: Huang Shan Mao Feng is a fragrant green tea from the Huangshan Mountains, known for its smooth taste and delicate leaves.
details.origin: Grown in the Huangshan Mountains of China, this tea is prized for its bright green leaves and fragrant aroma.
details.harvest_notes: Harvested in early spring, the tender buds are carefully processed to maintain their natural sweetness and freshness.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Huang Shan Mao Feng in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a refreshing cup.
details.health_benefits: This tea is rich in antioxidants and is said to promote heart health and boost immunity.
details.popularity: Highly respected in China, Huang Shan Mao Feng is a favorite for its light and refreshing taste.

details.description: Hōjicha is a Japanese roasted green tea that has a warm, toasty flavor and a lower caffeine content.
details.origin: Grown and roasted in Japan, Hōjicha is made by roasting green tea leaves, producing its distinctive flavor.
details.harvest_notes: The leaves are roasted at high temperatures, giving the tea a brown color and a rich, roasted flavor.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Hōjicha in water heated to 90°C (194°F) for 2-3 minutes for a smooth, roasted taste.
details.health_benefits: Hōjicha is gentle on the stomach and may aid digestion, thanks to its low caffeine content.
details.popularity: Popular in Japan, it’s often consumed in the evening due to its calming properties.

details.description: Jasmine Green Tea is a fragrant blend of green tea and jasmine blossoms, offering a soothing and aromatic infusion.
details.origin: This tea is widely consumed in China, where it is traditionally scented with fresh jasmine flowers.
details.harvest_notes: The tea leaves are scented with jasmine flowers during the blooming season, which imparts the tea’s distinctive fragrance.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Jasmine Green Tea in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a fragrant, floral cup.
details.health_benefits: This tea is known for its calming effects and may help with stress relief and digestion.
details.popularity: A popular choice in China, Jasmine Green Tea is known for its uplifting aroma and soothing qualities.

details.description: Kukicha, also known as 'twig tea,' is a Japanese green tea made from the stems and twigs of the tea plant, offering a mild, refreshing taste.
details.origin: Grown in Japan, Kukicha is made from the stems of leaves that are usually discarded, making it a unique and sustainable option.
details.harvest_notes: This tea is made by selecting young twigs and stems after the leaves have been harvested, giving it a less astringent flavor.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Kukicha in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes to enjoy its light, grassy taste.
details.health_benefits: Kukicha is known for its gentle detoxifying effects and is often consumed to improve digestion.
details.popularity: A favorite in Japanese homes, Kukicha is a mild tea enjoyed for its light and refreshing taste.

details.description: Lung Ching, also known as Dragon Well, is one of China’s most famous green teas, with a rich, nutty flavor and a delicate, refreshing finish.
details.origin: Grown in the Zhejiang Province of China, Lung Ching is prized for its smooth texture and natural sweetness.
details.harvest_notes: Hand-picked in early spring, the leaves are carefully pan-roasted to preserve their freshness and nutty flavor.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Lung Ching in water heated to 85°C (185°F) for 2-3 minutes for a crisp, flavorful cup.
details.health_benefits: Lung Ching is known for its high antioxidant content and is said to support digestion and improve energy levels.
details.popularity: A highly regarded tea, Lung Ching is often enjoyed for its balance of sweetness and roasted flavor.

details.description: Matcha is a powdered Japanese green tea made from finely ground shade-grown tea leaves, offering a rich, umami flavor and vibrant green color.
details.origin: Produced in Japan, Matcha is typically grown in the Uji region and is used in traditional tea ceremonies.
details.harvest_notes: The tea leaves are shaded before harvest to boost chlorophyll content, then ground into a fine powder to preserve flavor.
details.brewing_methods: For traditional preparation, whisk one teaspoon of Matcha powder in hot water (70°C-80°C/158°F-176°F) until frothy.
details.health_benefits: Matcha is rich in antioxidants, provides sustained energy, and promotes focus and calmness.
details.popularity: A favorite in Japan and increasingly popular worldwide, Matcha is revered for its flavor and health benefits.

details.description: Meng Ding Gan Lu is a prized green tea from Sichuan Province, known for its sweet and vegetal flavor with a delicate floral aroma.
details.origin: Grown in the Mengding Mountains, Sichuan, this tea is renowned for its unique sweetness and fragrant aroma.
details.harvest_notes: Harvested in early spring, the tea leaves are processed delicately to preserve their natural sweetness and floral character.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Meng Ding Gan Lu in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a smooth, refreshing infusion.
details.health_benefits: This tea is rich in antioxidants and is known for supporting heart health and digestion.
details.popularity: A highly regarded tea in China, Meng Ding Gan Lu is cherished for its smooth sweetness and unique flavor.

details.description: Morimoto Sencha is a Japanese green tea with a balanced, vegetal flavor and a smooth, refreshing aftertaste.
details.origin: Grown in Japan, this Sencha is typically harvested in the spring from young leaves.
details.harvest_notes: The leaves are steamed immediately after picking to preserve their freshness and green color.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Morimoto Sencha in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a refreshing cup.
details.health_benefits: Sencha is known to support overall health, with potential benefits for heart health and reducing inflammation.
details.popularity: Morimoto Sencha is a well-loved green tea in Japan, enjoyed for its clean and crisp flavor.

details.description: Tai Ping Huo Kui is a renowned green tea from the Anhui province of China, with large, flat leaves and a sweet, vegetal flavor.
details.origin: This tea is grown in the Tai Ping region, where its unique leaf shape and delicate flavor make it highly prized.
details.harvest_notes: The leaves are handpicked in the early spring and carefully processed to maintain their large, flat shape.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Tai Ping Huo Kui in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a sweet, vegetal infusion.
details.health_benefits: This tea is rich in antioxidants and is known for supporting digestion and boosting energy.
details.popularity: Tai Ping Huo Kui is highly respected in China and enjoyed by tea connoisseurs for its delicate taste.

details.description: Wu Yuan Ming Mei is a Chinese green tea from the Wu Yuan region, offering a fresh, floral flavor with a smooth, delicate finish.
details.origin: This tea comes from the Wu Yuan region of China, where it’s cultivated for its fresh, delicate taste.
details.harvest_notes: Picked in early spring, the leaves are processed carefully to preserve their freshness and subtle flavors.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Wu Yuan Ming Mei in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a fragrant and light cup.
details.health_benefits: Wu Yuan Ming Mei is rich in antioxidants and is known for its potential to reduce inflammation and support heart health.
details.popularity: A delicate and fragrant tea, Wu Yuan Ming Mei is enjoyed for its lightness and refreshing taste.

details.description: Zhu Ye Qing is a rare Chinese green tea known for its bright, fresh flavor and smooth, vegetal aftertaste.
details.origin: This tea is grown in the mountains of Sichuan, China, and is prized for its delicate, green flavor.
details.harvest_notes: Picked during the spring, the leaves are processed with great care to preserve their vibrant green color and refreshing taste.
details.brewing_methods: Steep one teaspoon of Zhu Ye Qing in water heated to 80°C (176°F) for 2-3 minutes for a clean, refreshing cup.
details.health_benefits: This tea offers a rich supply of antioxidants and may help with detoxification and supporting cardiovascular health.
details.popularity: Zhu Ye Qing is highly prized for its light, sweet flavor and delicate aroma.

Black Teas.description: 2Explore different types of tea, their production processes and health advantages, while keeping track of your personal tea journey.

tea.name: An Ju Bai Cha
tea.description: An Ju Bai Cha is a delicate tea often classified alongside green tea due to its light processing. This tea offers a subtle sweetness and a refreshing aroma, making it a perfect choice for those who appreciate a gentle flavor.
tea.benefits: This tea is rich in antioxidants, which promote hydration and may aid in digestion, contributing to overall well-being.
tea.brewing: To brew An Ju Bai Cha, use water heated to 80°C. Steep the tea leaves for 3 to 5 minutes to extract their delicate flavors.

tea.name: Bancha
tea.description: Bancha is an everyday green tea made from mature leaves, offering a robust flavor and a comforting aroma. It's commonly enjoyed in Japanese households and provides a satisfying experience without being overly strong.
tea.benefits: Enjoying Bancha may help with weight management and support heart health, making it a wholesome addition to your daily routine.
tea.brewing: Brew Bancha using water heated to 80°C. Steep for 2 to 3 minutes for a refreshing cup.

tea.name: Bi Luo Chun
tea.description: Bi Luo Chun, known for its fragrant aroma and delicate flavor, is hand-picked in spring. Its name translates to 'Green Snail Spring', reflecting its tightly rolled leaves that unfurl beautifully during brewing.
tea.benefits: This tea is rich in antioxidants, which may improve brain function and reduce stress levels, providing a soothing choice.
tea.brewing: To prepare Bi Luo Chun, heat water to 80°C and steep the leaves for 2 to 3 minutes to reveal their floral notes.

tea.name: Dragon Well (Longjing)
tea.description: Dragon Well, or Longjing, is one of China's most famous green teas, characterized by its flat leaves and nutty flavor. It is often hand-roasted to enhance its unique taste and aroma.
tea.benefits: This tea may enhance metabolism and support skin health, making it a popular choice among health enthusiasts.
tea.brewing: Brew Dragon Well with water heated to 85°C, steeping for 2 to 3 minutes to enjoy its rich flavor.

tea.name: En Shi Yu Lu
tea.description: En Shi Yu Lu is a high-quality green tea from Hubei, celebrated for its refreshing taste and rich aroma. Its unique production methods contribute to its distinct flavor profile.
tea.benefits: Enjoying this tea may support immune function and enhance overall health.
tea.brewing: For the best flavor, use water heated to 80°C and steep the leaves for 2 to 3 minutes.

tea.name: Fenggang Zinc Selenium Tea
tea.description: Fenggang Zinc Selenium Tea is known for its rich mineral content, particularly zinc and selenium. This green tea is celebrated for its potential health benefits.
tea.benefits: This tea may support immune health and has anti-inflammatory properties, making it a great addition to a healthy lifestyle.
tea.brewing: To brew this tea, heat water to 85°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes for optimal flavor.

tea.name: Genmaicha
tea.description: Genmaicha is a unique blend of green tea and roasted brown rice, offering a nutty flavor and soothing aroma. It's often referred to as 'popcorn tea' due to the appearance of the roasted rice.
tea.benefits: This tea may help reduce stress and promote digestion, making it a comforting choice.
tea.brewing: Brew Genmaicha with water heated to 80°C. Steep for 3 to 5 minutes to enjoy its rich, nutty flavors.

tea.name: Gyokuro
tea.description: Gyokuro is a premium shade-grown green tea with a sweet and rich flavor. Its unique growing conditions produce a tea that is smooth and full-bodied.
tea.benefits: This tea may enhance relaxation and focus, making it ideal for moments of calm.
tea.brewing: For Gyokuro, use water heated to 60°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes to extract its delicate flavors.

tea.name: Huang Shan Mao Feng
tea.description: Huang Shan Mao Feng is a fragrant green tea known for its smooth taste and tender leaves, grown in the famous Huangshan Mountains.
tea.benefits: This tea may support heart health and improve mood, providing a delightful experience.
tea.brewing: Brew Huang Shan Mao Feng with water heated to 80°C, steeping for 2 to 3 minutes for the best results.

tea.name: Hōjicha
tea.description: Hōjicha is a roasted green tea that boasts a warm, toasty flavor. The roasting process gives it a unique aroma and a low caffeine content, making it a great evening tea.
tea.benefits: This tea may aid in digestion and promote relaxation, making it perfect for winding down.
tea.brewing: Brew Hōjicha with water heated to 90°C and steep for 1 to 2 minutes to capture its rich, toasty flavors.

tea.name: Jasmine Green Tea
tea.description: Jasmine Green Tea is scented with jasmine flowers, creating a beautifully aromatic and refreshing experience. This tea combines the floral fragrance with the green tea's fresh taste.
tea.benefits: Enjoying Jasmine Green Tea may help reduce stress and improve mood, providing a delightful choice for relaxation.
tea.brewing: Brew Jasmine Green Tea using water heated to 80°C, steeping for 2 to 3 minutes to enjoy its floral notes.

tea.name: Kukicha
tea.description: Kukicha, also known as twig tea, is made from the stems and twigs of the tea plant, offering a mild, slightly sweet flavor that is unique among green tea varieties.
tea.benefits: This tea may assist with hydration and digestion, making it a great choice for any time of day.
tea.brewing: To brew Kukicha, heat water to 80°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes for a refreshing cup.

tea.name: Luan Gua Pian
tea.description: Luan Gua Pian is a unique green tea with a slightly sweet flavor and a refreshing aftertaste. The leaves are picked and processed to create a bright yellow-green infusion.
tea.benefits: This tea is believed to enhance digestion and boost energy levels, making it a refreshing option throughout the day.
tea.brewing: Brew Luan Gua Pian with water heated to 80°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes for optimal flavor.

tea.name: Matcha
tea.description: Matcha is a finely ground green tea powder that is whisked into hot water. Known for its vibrant green color and rich flavor, it offers a unique and invigorating tea experience.
tea.benefits: Rich in nutrients, matcha may support concentration and mental clarity while providing a calming effect.
tea.brewing: To brew matcha, use water heated to 80°C. Whisk the powder vigorously for 1 to 2 minutes until frothy.

tea.name: Meng Ding Gan Lu
tea.description: Meng Ding Gan Lu, known for its rich flavor and fragrant aroma, is grown in the Mengding Mountains. It features tender leaves that yield a sweet and refreshing brew.
tea.benefits: This tea is associated with enhanced focus and a feeling of calm, making it ideal for mindfulness moments.
tea.brewing: Brew Meng Ding Gan Lu with water heated to 80°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes for the best flavor.

tea.name: Sencha
tea.description: Sencha is a popular Japanese green tea known for its vibrant green color and refreshing flavor. The leaves are steamed, preserving their natural sweetness and umami taste.
tea.benefits: This tea may promote hydration and energy, making it a great choice for a morning boost.
tea.brewing: Brew Sencha with water heated to 70°C, steeping for 1 to 2 minutes to enjoy its refreshing qualities.

tea.name: Tai Ping Huo Kui
tea.description: Tai Ping Huo Kui is a rare green tea known for its long, flat leaves and sweet, vegetal flavor. It is hand-processed to preserve its delicate qualities.
tea.benefits: This tea may provide a calming effect and support mental clarity, making it a delightful afternoon choice.
tea.brewing: Brew Tai Ping Huo Kui with water heated to 85°C and steep for 3 to 4 minutes for an exquisite cup.

tea.name: Wu Yuan Ming Mei
tea.description: Wu Yuan Ming Mei is a fragrant green tea with a slightly sweet flavor and a bright green infusion. It is known for its beautifully twisted leaves.
tea.benefits: This tea may enhance focus and promote relaxation, making it an ideal companion for meditation.
tea.brewing: Brew Wu Yuan Ming Mei with water heated to 80°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes for the best results.

tea.name: Zhu Ye Qing
tea.description: Zhu Ye Qing is a high-quality green tea known for its bright green color and refreshing taste. Its delicate leaves yield a sweet and smooth infusion.
tea.benefits: Enjoying Zhu Ye Qing may support digestion and provide a gentle boost of energy.
tea.brewing: Brew Zhu Ye Qing with water heated to 80°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes for a delightful experience.

tea.description: Zhu Ye Qing is a high-quality green tea known for its bright green color and refreshing taste. Its delicate leaves yield a sweet and smooth infusion.
tea.benefits: Enjoying Zhu Ye Qing may support digestion and provide a gentle boost of energy.
tea.brewing: Brew Zhu Ye Qing with water heated to 80°C and steep for 2 to 3 minutes for a delightful experience.
